intro: Cheiridopsis rudis, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact, succulent growth habit and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in arid and rocky environments, often growing on limestone soils. Cheiridopsis rudis is well adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a hardy plant suitable for xeriscaping.
